intro: Aspalathus spinosissima subsp. spinosissima, commonly known as the spiny aspalathus, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, needle-like leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
